intro: Didissandra labordei, commonly known as the laborde's didissandra, is a rare and unique plant native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, waxy leaves and unusual, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is a climbing shrub that often grows along the forest floor or on tree trunks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
